p: Severe acute respiratory syndrome coronavirus 2 (SARS-CoV-2) is a new betacoronavirus that was first reported in Wuhan, China, in December 2019; this virus has caused the worst pandemic of the past 100 years [ 1- 3]. On December 31, 2019, Chinese authorities notified the World Health Organization (WHO) of an outbreak of pneumonia in Wuhan [ 2]. The WHO declared the coronavirus disease (COVID-19) outbreak to be a public health emergency of international concern on January 30, 2020, and it was declared a pandemic on March 12 [ 2, 4]. It is commonly believed that the outbreak began in early December 2019.
